FuncDef:
The isis ipv6 link-group command binds an IS-IS IPv6 interface to an existing link group.
The undo isis ipv6 link-group command unbinds an IS-IS IPv6 interface from a link group.
By default, an IS-IS IPv6 interface is not bound to any link group.
CLIs: isis ipv6 [ topology <topology-name> ] link-group <group-name> [ level-1 | level-2 ]
undo isis ipv6 [ topology <topology-name> ] link-group [ <group-name> ] [ level-1 | level-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an IS-IS topology.
After the name of an IS-IS topology is specified, the routes that travel through the member links in the link group are calculated only for this topology.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z, case sensitive) and can contain numbers, hyphens (-), or underlines (_). When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of a link group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters. When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Binds a Level-1 IPv6 interface to the link group.
-

Binds a Level-2 IPv6 interface to the link group.
If neither level-1 nor level-2 is specified in the command, both Level-1 and Level-2 IPv6 interfaces are bound to the link group.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a link group is created in the IS-IS view, run the isis link-group or isis ipv6 link-group command to bind a specified interface to the link group for the link group to take effect.
Prerequisites
IPv6 IS-IS has been enabled using the isis ipv6 enable command, and a link group has been created using the link-group command.
